tool.name: HyPhy-SLAC
tool.command: ln -s '$input_file' slac_input.fa && ln -s '$input_nhx' slac_input.nhx && echo $gencodeid > tool_params && echo `pwd`/slac_input.fa >> tool_params && echo `pwd`/slac_input.nhx >> tool_params && echo '$branches' >> tool_params && echo '$number_of_samples' >> tool_params && echo '$p_value' >> tool_params && @HYPHY_INVOCATION@ \$HYPHY_LIB/TemplateBatchFiles/SelectionAnalyses/SLAC.bf > '$slac_log'

param.name: gencodeid
param.label: Genetic code
param.option: Mold, Protozoan and Coelenterate mt; Mycloplasma/Spiroplasma
Ciliate, Dasycladacean and Hexamita Nuclear code

param.name: number_of_samples
param.label: Number of samples used to assess ancestral reconstruction uncertainty

tool.help: SLAC (Single-Likelihood Ancestor Counting) uses a combination of maximum-likelihood and counting approaches to infer nonsynonymous and synonymous substitution rates on a per-site basis for a given coding alignment and corresponding phylogeny. SLAC assumes that the selection pressure for each site is constant along the entire phylogeny.
